heroIntro: Welcome to your family home in Ciudad Quesada, a thriving residential community on the Costa Blanca where modern living meets Mediterranean lifestyle. This exceptional 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom villa offers 189m² of thoughtfully designed living space on a 248m² plot—the perfect foundation for a growing family. At €449,500, this property represents outstanding value at €2,378/m², which is remarkably 40% less expensive than comparable properties on Spain's island markets. Located within the prestigious Golf La Marquesa community, you'll find a safe, well-established neighbourhood where families thrive alongside an international community that shares your values. The villa's generous layout provides the space children need to play and grow, while parents enjoy modern amenities and proximity to quality schools, healthcare facilities, and beautiful beaches. Whether you're seeking a permanent base for your family's Spanish adventure or a smart investment property with strong rental potential, this Ciudad Quesada villa delivers on every front.
areaSection: Ciudad Quesada sits in the heart of the Costa Blanca, just inland from Alicante's coast. This strategic location places you within reach of both beaches and the countryside, making it ideal for families who want variety in their lifestyle. The area enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with mild winters and warm summers—perfect for outdoor family activities year-round. Golf La Marquesa, where this villa is situated, is one of the region's most respected residential communities, developed specifically for those seeking quality living in a secure, family-oriented setting. The neighbourhood has evolved into a vibrant expat hub with excellent infrastructure, making the transition to Spanish living smooth and enjoyable for families from the UK, Northern Europe, and beyond.
lifestyleSection: Life in Ciudad Quesada revolves around community, outdoor activities, and the relaxed Mediterranean pace that families love. Your days might begin with breakfast on your terrace, followed by a swim at one of the nearby Blue Flag beaches just 20 minutes away, or a round of golf at the championship courses surrounding the area. The established international community means excellent English-language support—from schools to healthcare to restaurants and social groups. Weekly visits to local markets offer fresh produce and a genuine taste of Spanish culture, while supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl provide familiar shopping experiences. Evenings bring outdoor dining, family walks through the neighbourhood, and a strong sense of safety and belonging. The region's healthcare infrastructure includes private clinics with English-speaking doctors, ensuring your family's wellbeing is never compromised. With an active expat community, you'll find established social groups, international schools, and family-friendly activities that make settling in remarkably easy.
investmentSection: Beyond providing your family's ideal home, this villa represents a sound financial investment. Ciudad Quesada is experiencing strong market growth at +8% year-on-year, significantly outpacing inflation and demonstrating solid property appreciation. The rental market is equally compelling—typical weekly rentals in the area command €800 or more, offering families genuine income potential during periods when the villa isn't in use. At €2,378/m², this property is positioned 40% below equivalent Spanish island properties, providing exceptional value as the Costa Blanca market continues to strengthen. The golf community setting and proximity to beaches make this an attractive rental proposition for holiday lettings, particularly during peak summer months. Property costs remain manageable, with Spanish wealth taxes and ongoing expenses significantly lower than comparable UK properties, making this a financially intelligent decision for forward-thinking families.
conclusion: This Ciudad Quesada villa represents far more than property—it's the foundation for your family's Mediterranean adventure. The combination of outstanding value (€449,500 for premium specification), excellent investment potential (+8% annual appreciation), and proven lifestyle benefits creates a compelling case for families ready to embrace Spanish living. The safe, English-friendly Golf La Marquesa community removes barriers to relocation, while proximity to beaches, schools, and healthcare ensures family wellbeing remains paramount. Whether seeking a permanent residence or a strategically sound investment with rental income potential, this villa delivers on every meaningful measure. Your family deserves space to grow, safety to thrive, and a lifestyle that brings genuine joy—this property provides all three. Contact us today via WhatsApp to arrange a private viewing. faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign nationals have identical property ownership rights as Spanish citizens—no restrictions exist on purchasing residential property. Your villa would be owned in your name with full legal protection. Many UK and international families own Spanish property successfully. Professional Spanish legal advisors familiar with foreign buyers guide the straightforward purchase process.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment location. The region experiences consistent +8% annual appreciation, strong rental demand (€800+ weekly typical), and attracts hundreds of thousands of international visitors annually. Currency advantages favour UK buyers, and the established expat infrastructure provides familiar support systems. Long-term value and lifestyle benefits combine to make Costa Blanca property ownership increasingly popular among discerning families.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €449,500 purchase price, expect: transfer tax (6-8%), notary and registration fees (approximately 1%), and professional legal advice (typically €800-1,500). Total acquisition costs usually total 8-10% of purchase price. Ongoing costs include annual property tax (modest rates), community fees (varies by area), and utilities. These costs remain significantly lower than equivalent UK property purchases, making Spanish ownership highly cost-effective.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically covering 70-80% of property value. British and international borrowers frequently qualify with competitive rates often lower than UK mortgages. Standard requirements include proof of income, employment contracts, and financial references. Professional mortgage brokers specialising in foreign buyers streamline the process considerably, making Spanish financing highly accessible for qualified applicants.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is approximately 25-30% lower than equivalent UK living standards. Groceries, dining, utilities, and healthcare all cost substantially less. A family of four typically lives comfortably on €2,000-2,500 monthly. The mild climate reduces heating costs, and Spanish healthcare costs are minimal compared to UK private care. These economics make Mediterranean family living genuinely affordable without lifestyle compromise.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. The Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with mild winters (rarely below 10°C) and warm summers (25-30°C). Rainfall is minimal, averaging 250mm annually. The Mediterranean climate enables year-round outdoor activities—beach swimming, golf, garden entertaining, and sports throughout every season. This consistent sunshine supports family wellbeing and active outdoor living impossible in most UK climates.

Summer temperatures make beach swimming comfortable from May through October, and quieter shoulder seasons offer family-friendly atmospheres away from peak crowds.

These schools maintain high academic standards, small class sizes, and international pupil communities.
